citation.article-title: Yersinia frederiksenii: a new species of Enterobacteriaceae composed of rhamnose-positive strains, formerly called atypical Yersinia enterocolitica or Yersinia enterocolitica-like.

p.s: Description of Yersinia frederiksenii sp. nov.

Yersinia frederiksenii (named in honor of Wilhelm Frederiksen, the Danish microbiologist who made substantial contributions to the characterization of yersiniae. It is pronounced "fred-er-ick-sin'-ee")
The type strain of Y. frederiksenii is 6175 (=CIP 80-29), isolated from sewage in Denmark.
The biochemical characteristics of strain 6175 are shown in Table 1.
It does not belong to any described O antigen group.

Isolation of Y. frederiksenii from human stools usually reflects only transient carriage (especially if cold enrichment is necessary). Y. frederiksenii should be considered an opportunistic pathogen for humans, and the clinical significance of such strains should be weighed in view of the epidemiological data.
The G+C content of three Y. frederiksenii strains (867, 5981, and 6175), as determined by optical thermal denaturation, was 48 mol%.
